Detailed Description

A class similar to the ByteArrayInputStream and ByteArrayOutputStream in java.

It is possible to write small chunks of data into the ByteBuffer and then reading them in chunks of any size.

Zeroes the totalsize.

ByteBuffer::ByteBuffer (  const ByteBuffer &  other  ) 
 

Copy constructor.

Will create one new buffer in the list even if other has many buffers in its list.

virtual ByteBuffer::~ByteBuffer (   )  [virtual]
 

Destructor.

Deletes the contents of the list.

Member Function Documentation

int ByteBuffer::ack (  int  len  ) 
 

Tells the ByteBuffer to advance the read position by len bytes.

Can be used together with peek when resending data.

Parameters:
len The length to advance the read position with.
Returns:
The number of bytes that the read position was advanced.

int ByteBuffer::add (  byte  buffer[],
int  len
) 
 

Puts the supplied buffer at the end of the ByteBuffer.

The buffer belongs to the ByteBuffer after this, i.e. no copy is made and the supplied buffer should not be used anymore.

Parameters:
buffer The buffer to write.
len The number of bytes in the buffer to write.
Returns:
len if everything went ok.

DataBuffer* ByteBuffer::copyToDataBuffer (   )  const
 

Copies the byteBuffer to a DataBuffer.

The position in the DataBuffer will be after the written bytes and the size will be the same as the size of the ByteBuffer. The byteBuffer will not be changed.

int ByteBuffer::getNbrBytes (   )  const
 

Returns the number of bytes in the ByteBuffer.

Returns:
The total number of bytes in the ByteBuffer.

int ByteBuffer::peek (  byte *  data,
int  len,
ByteBufList::const_iterator  it
)  const [protected]
 

Recursive function used by peek to get data from the elements.

Parameters:
data The data pointer where read bytes should be put.
len The remaining length to be read.
it The current element to peek into.

int ByteBuffer::peek (  byte *  data,
int  len
)  const
 

Reads len bytes of data from the buffer, but does not update the read position.

I.e. two subsequent calls to peek should yield the same result.

Parameters:
data Buffer to put the read data into.
len The number of wanted bytes.
Returns:
The number of bytes that were put into data.

int ByteBuffer::read (  byte *  data,
int  len
) 
 

Puts up to len bytes of data into the supplied buffer and updates the read position.

The bytes cannot be read again.

Parameters:
data Buffer to put the read data into.
len The wanted number of bytes to read.
Returns:
The number of bytes that were actually read.

ssize_t ByteBuffer::write (  const byte *  data,
size_t  len,
uint32  timeout
)  [virtual]
 

Writes len bytes of data at the end of the buffer.

Calls write without timeout.

Parameters:
data The data to write.
len The length of the data.
timeout 
Returns:
len if everything is ok. Negative number if an error occured.

Implements Writeable.

Writes len bytes of data at the end of the buffer.
